comments.body:
There's one more test which could be relevant (since healthcheck parsing is pretty complex, it could happen that not specifying a healthcheck is treated as healthcheck changed or removed, which we want to avoid):
```suggestion

- name: healthcheck (no change)
  docker_container:
    image: alpine:3.8
    command: '/bin/sh -c "sleep 10m"'
    name: "{{ cname }}"
    state: started
    stop_timeout: 1
  register: healthcheck_4
```
(The `healthcheck_` numbers have to be adjusted below, and a `healthcheck_4 is not changed` has to be added to the assert.)
Make sense. I will update healthcheck tests.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1188,1192 @@    stop_timeout: 1
  register: healthcheck_3

- name: healthcheck (no change)
  docker_container:

comments.body: If the above type is changed to `set(dict)`, you should change the order of the elements in the list (it should still be idempotent).
Can you adjust the tests simliar to the ones for `dns_opts`, so that they also run through for docker-py < 1.10.0?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2785,2789 @@    state: started
    pids_limit: 10
  register: pids_limit_1
  ignore_errors: yes

comments.body: You should always add `force_kill: yes` if you change something, otherwise docker will wait 10 seconds or so when stopping.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2454,2458 @@    name: "{{ cname }}"
    state: started
    network_mode: "container:{{ cname_h1 }}"
    force_kill: yes
  register: network_mode_4

comments.body: Maybe use `"yes"`, to have another truish value which would get corrupted (and probably not converted back correctly by any sane implementation).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1181,1185 @@      TEST2: val2
      TEST3: "False"
      TEST4: "true"
      TEST5: "yes"
  register: env_1
